result.execSummary:
The defendant Derak Az Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
with addendum
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Cases 15CF29, 15CF57 and 15CF71 called together at 3:28pm
Defendant Derak Az Schultz in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Schultz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing on all cases; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted, reading of all waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Case 15CF29 Count #3, Case 15CF57 Count #5, and Case 15CF71 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Statement made by Mr. Schultz's mother

Atty. Zarwell requests that Mr. Schultz's cell phone be returned when no longer needed for evidentiary purposes.

On Case 15CF29 Count #3, Case 15CF57 Count #5, and Case 15CF71 Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--On Case 15CF29 to serve 8 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/ Huber privileges, to commence on June 16, 2015 at 9:00pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (1 time per month for first 6 months after release from jail; per Agent thereafter)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession on a controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with Tommy Herrmann or Allen May
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee/Sheriff
--Case 15CF29 Count #3: to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $125 drug testing fee(drug testing fee is joint and several with Allen May)
--Case 15CF57 Count #5: to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $75 drug testing fee plus $510 buy money reimbursement
--Case 15CF71 Count #1: to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $50 drug testing fee plus $340 buy money reimbursement


On Case 15CF29: Days credit for time already served:  3  days
On Case 15CF57: Days credit for time already served:  0  days
On Case 15CF71: Days credit for time already served:  0  days

On Case 15CF57: The Court grants Mr. Schultz the right to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation
On Case 15CF71: The Court grants Mr. Schultz the right to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation

The Court orders that the money retrieved in case 15CV78 be forfeit.
The Court orders that the cellular phone belonging to Mr. Schultz be returned to him after the post-conviction time period on these cases(20days). 

recess: 4:25pm--reconvene: 4:27pm 

Mr. Schultz is to report to Probation tomorrow due to the late conclusion time of this hearing.

Case called at 1:46pm.  Clerk - CRHI.
Defendant Derak Anthony Zachary Schultz in court with attorney  Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.  Defendant Derak A. Z. Schultz in custody.   SPD appears for boond only. 
Public Service Special Prosecutor Atty. Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agreement of counsel, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and the mailing address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. Physical address of 324 N. Elizabeth  St. #6, Jefferson, WI also given. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given. Constitutional rights are given.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Allen May
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
